page.title: 05WENCHFORD PICNIC SITE
page.content: The Forestry Commission has provided a number of picnic sites in the forest and there is one alongside the B4431 road (Blakeney - Parkend) as it runs up the deep valley between the Viney and Blakeney Hills. It has been named Wenchford by the Commission but it is known locally as "The Straits". Parking is provided along the embankment of a former railway line and between this track and the road, Blackpool Brook winds its way towards Blakeney. Here there are barbeques, wooden picnic tables and toilet facilities. Wenchford is a very pleasant place to visit especially in the Autumn and Spring seasons but can be rather over-populated in the Summer months. It as a playground for local children.
